Notes: "Arion ater and Arion rufus (the two species in the subgenus known from the Pacific Northwest) can only by differentiated by dissection comparing genitalia or with DNA sequence data (Burke and Leonard 2013, Forsyth 2005). These authors also report that the black morph of Arion rufus is not uncommon in the Pacific Northwest. Further, Arion ater can be brownish with a reddish foot fringe (Rowson et al. 2014). Zemanova et al. 2018 used genetic sequence data to confirm Arion ater in Washington State. Thus, unless accompanied by an image of dissected genitalia or DNA sequence data, Subgenus Arion (Ater-group Arion Slugs) is the safest bet for these slugs." (Casey H. Richart, pers. comm. 2021)
